content:
Hi All

I was looking at using bincode to send some data over unix sockets, and in my toy examples, I'm finding that the reader locks up (rather than erroring) on bad data (e.g. sending a bunch of "a"'s down the socket before sending the actual data). Is that expected (I'd expect an error rather than the code simply locking up), or does that sound like a bug? I could be using bincode wrong though, happy to post my example code.
bincode is likely interpreting the bad data as lengths, and reading the amount of data those lengths expect. That'll make it block waiting for more data.
